summary: Herbert Matthews was a journalist whose name appears in the context of influencing Fidel Castro. A 1960 meeting discussed using Matthews, along with Ed Murrow, to influence Castro and exploit potential splits within his regime. There is no direct evidence in these documents to suggest Matthews had any involvement in the JFK assassination. His significance lies in his potential role as a media influencer during the early years of the Cuban Revolution.
